interestingFact: India is the world's largest democracy and has the second-largest population.
The U.S. has the world's largest economy and is known for its cultural and scientific influence.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, spanning 11 time zones.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent and is known for its unique wildlife.
Japan consists of over 6,800 islands and is known for its advanced technology and traditions.
Germany is the largest economy in Europe and is famous for its engineering and innovation.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on some occasions.
France is the most visited country in the world, known for its cuisine, fashion, and landmarks.
South Africa has three capital cities and is known for its rich cultural diversity and wildlife.
